intro: Dasystachys africana, commonly known as African grassvetch, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with hairy surfaces. Dasystachys africana is known for its ability to tolerate drought and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
